001package imagingbook.lib.image.data;
002
003import java.util.Arrays;
004
005import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
006import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
007import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
008import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
009import ij.process.ShortProcessor;
010import imagingbook.lib.color.Rgb;
011import imagingbook.lib.filter.GenericFilter;
012import imagingbook.lib.image.access.GridIndexer2D;
013import imagingbook.lib.image.access.OutOfBoundsStrategy;
014
015/**
016 * This class defines a generic data container for scalar and
017 * vector-valued images, using float-values throughout.
018 * Its primary use is in the {@link GenericFilter} framework. 
019 * 
020 * @author WB
021 * @version 2021/01/14
022 */
023public class PixelPack {
024        
025        /** The default out-of-bounds strategy (see {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy}). */
026        public static final OutOfBoundsStrategy DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy = OutOfBoundsStrategy.NEAREST_BORDER;
027
028        private final int depth;
029        private final float[][] data;
030        private final int length;
031        private final GridIndexer2D indexer;
032        
033        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
034        
035        /**
036         * Constructor. Creates a blank (zero-valued) pack of pixel data.
037         * @param width the image width
038         * @param height the image height
039         * @param depth the number of channels (slices)
040         * @param obs the strategy to be used when reading from out-of-bounds coordinates
041         */
042        public PixelPack(int width, int height, int depth, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs) {
043                this.depth = depth;
044                this.length = width * height;
045                this.data = new float[depth][length];
046                this.indexer = GridIndexer2D.create(width, height, obs);
047        }
048        
049        /**
050         * Constructor. Creates a pack of pixel data from the given 
051         * {@link ImageProcessor} object. Uses
052         * {@link #DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy} as the out-of-bounds strategy
053         * (see {@link OutOfBoundsStrategy}).
054         * @param ip the source image
055         */
056        public PixelPack(ImageProcessor ip) {
057                this(ip, DefaultOutOfBoundsStrategy);
058        }
059        
060        /**
061         * Creates a pack of pixel data from the given 
062         * {@link ImageProcessor} object, using the specified out-of-bounds strategy.
063         * @param ip the source image
064         * @param obs the strategy to be used when reading from out-of-bounds coordinates
065         */
066        public PixelPack(ImageProcessor ip, OutOfBoundsStrategy obs) {
067                this(ip.getWidth(), ip.getHeight(), ip.getNChannels(), obs);
068                copyFromImageProcessor(ip, this);
069        }
070        
071        /**
072         * Constructor. Duplicates an existing {@link PixelPack} without copying 
073         * the contained pixel data.
074         * @param orig the original {@link PixelPack}
075         */
076        public PixelPack(PixelPack orig) {
077                this(orig, false);
078        }
079        
080        /**
081         * Constructor. Duplicates an existing {@link PixelPack}, optionally copying 
082         * the contained pixel data.
083         * @param orig the original {@link PixelPack}
084         * @param copyData set true to copy pixel data
085         */
086        public PixelPack(PixelPack orig, boolean copyData) {
087                this(orig.getWidth(), orig.getHeight(), orig.getDepth(), orig.indexer.getOutOfBoundsStrategy());
088                if (copyData) {
089                        orig.copyTo(this);
090                }
091        }
092        
093        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
094
095        /**
096         * Returns the pixel data at the specified position as a float-vector.
097         * If the supplied array is non-null, it is filled in and returned,
098         * otherwise a new array is returned.
099         * The length of this array corresponds to the number of slices in this
100         * pixel pack.
101         * The values returned at out-of-bounds positions depends on this
102         * pixel-pack's out-of-bounds strategy.
103         * 
104         * @param u the x-position
105         * @param v the y-position
106         * @param vals a suitable 
107         * @return the array of pixel data
108         */
109        public float[] getVec(int u, int v, float[] vals) {
110                if (vals == null) 
111                        vals = new float[depth];
112                final int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
113                if (i < 0) {    // i = -1 --> default value (zero)
114                        Arrays.fill(vals, 0);
115                }
116                else {  
117                        for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
118                                vals[k] = data[k][i];
119                        }
120                }
121                return vals;
122        }
123        
124        // returns a new pixel array
125        public float[] getVec(int u, int v) {
126                return getVec(u, v, new float[depth]);
127        }
128        
129        /**
130         * Sets the pixel data at the specified pixel position.
131         * The length of the value array corresponds to the number of slices in this
132         * pixel pack.
133         * @param u the x-position
134         * @param v the y-position
135         * @param vals a float vector with the values for this pixel
136         */
137        public void setVec(int u, int v, float ... vals) {
138                final int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
139                if (i >= 0) {
140                        for (int k = 0; k < depth && k < vals.length; k++) {
141                                data[k][i] = vals[k];
142                        }
143                }
144        }
145        
146        /**
147         * Copies the contents of one pixel pack to another.
148         * The involved pixel packs must have the same dimensions.
149         * @param other another pixel pack
150         */
151        public void copyTo(PixelPack other) {
152                if (!this.isCompatibleTo(other)) {
153                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("pixel packs of incompatible size, cannot copy");
154                }
155                for (int k = 0; k < this.depth; k++) {
156                        System.arraycopy(this.data[k], 0, other.data[k], 0, this.length);
157                }
158        }
159        
160        /**
161         * Checks is this pixel pack has the same dimensions as another
162         * pixel pack, i.e., can be copied to it.
163         * @param other the other pixel pack
164         * @return true if both have the same dimensions
165         */
166        public boolean isCompatibleTo(PixelPack other) {
167                if (this.data.length == other.data.length && this.length == other.length) { // TODO: check width/height too
168                        return true;
169                }
170                else
171                        return false;
172        }
173        
174        /**
175         * Returns a reference to the specified {@link PixelSlice}.
176         * An exception is thrown if the specified slice does not exist.
177         * @param k the slice index (0,...,K-1)
178         * @return a reference to the pixel slice
179         */
180        public PixelSlice getSlice(int k) throws IllegalArgumentException {
181                if (k < 0 || k >= depth) {
182                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("illegal slice number " + k);
183                }
184                return new PixelSlice(k);
185        }
186        
187        /**
188         * Creates and returns a new {@link PixelSlice} with the same dimensions
189         * and out-of-bounds strategy as this {@link PixelPack}.
190         * @return a new pixel slice
191         */
192        public PixelSlice getEmptySlice() {
193                return new PixelSlice();
194        }
195        
196        /**
197         * Returns a reference to this {@link PixelPack}'s internal data
198         * array, which is always two-dimensional:
199         * dimension 1 is the slice index,
200         * dimension 2 is the pixel index (each slice is a 1D array).
201         * @return the pixel pack's data array
202         */
203        public float[][] getArrays() {
204                return data;
205        }
206        
207        /**
208         * Returns the width of the associated image.
209         * @return the image width
210         */
211        public int getWidth() {
212                return this.indexer.getWidth();
213        }
214        
215        /**
216         * Returns the height of the associated image.
217         * @return the image height
218         */
219        public int getHeight() {
220                return this.indexer.getHeight();
221        }
222        
223        /**
224         * Returns the depth (number of slices) of the associated image.
225         * @return the image depth
226         */
227        public int getDepth() {
228                return this.depth;
229        }
230        
231        /**
232         * Returns the out-of-bounds strategy.
233         * @return the out-of-bounds strategy
234         */
235        public OutOfBoundsStrategy getOutOfBoundsStrategy() {
236                return this.indexer.getOutOfBoundsStrategy();
237        }
238
239        /**
240         * Sets all values of this pixel pack to zero.
241         */
242        public void zero() {
243                for (int k = 0; k < depth; k++) {
244                        getSlice(k).zero();
245                }
246        }
247        
248        /**
249         * Returns the pixel values in the 3x3 neighborhood around the
250         * specified position.
251         * The returned float-array has the structure {@code [x][y][k]},
252         * with x,y = 0,...,2  and k is the slice index.
253         * 
254         * @param uc the center x-position
255         * @param vc the center x-position
256         * @param nh a float array to be filled in (or null)
257         * @return the neighborhood array
258         */
259        public float[][][] get3x3Neighborhood(int uc, int vc, float[][][] nh) {
260                if (nh == null) 
261                        nh = new float[3][3][depth];
262                for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
263                        int u = uc - 1 + i;
264                        for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++) {
265                                int v = vc - 1 + j;
266                                nh[i][j] = getVec(u, v);
267                        }
268                }
269                return nh;
270        }
271        
272        /**
273         * Copies the contents of this pixel pack to the supplied {@link ImageProcessor}
274         * instance, if compatible. Otherwise an exception is thrown.
275         * 
276         * @param ip the target image processor
277         */
278        public void copyToImageProcessor(ImageProcessor ip) throws IllegalArgumentException {
279                if (this.getWidth() != ip.getWidth() || this.getHeight() != ip.getHeight()) {
280                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot copy to image processor, incompatible width or height");
281                }
282                if (this.getDepth() != ip.getNChannels()) {
283                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot copy to image processor, wrong depth");
284                }
285                copyToImageProcessor(this, ip);
286        }
287        
288        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
289        
290        /**
291         * Inner class representing a single (scalar-valued) pixel slice of a 
292         * (vector-valued) {@link PixelPack}.
293         *
294         */
295        public class PixelSlice {
296                private final int idx;
297                private final float[] vals;
298                
299                /**
300                 * Constructor. Creates a pixel slice for the specified component.
301                 * @param idx the slice (component) index
302                 */
303                PixelSlice(int idx) {
304                        this.idx = idx;
305                        this.vals = data[idx];
306                }
307                
308                /** Constructor. Creates an empty (zero-values) pixel slice with the same
309                 * properties as the containing pixel pack but not associated
310                 * with it.
311                 */
312                PixelSlice() {
313                        this.idx = -1;
314                        this.vals = new float[length];
315                }
316                
317                /**
318                 * Returns the slice value for the specified image position.
319                 * @param u the x-position
320                 * @param v the y-position
321                 * @return the slice value
322                 */
323                public float getVal(int u, int v) {
324                        int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
325                        return (i >= 0) ? vals[i] : 0;
326                }
327                
328                /**
329                 * Sets the slice value at the specified image position.
330                 * @param u the x-position
331                 * @param v the y-position
332                 * @param val the new value
333                 */
334                public void setVal(int u, int v, float val) {
335                        int i = indexer.getIndex(u, v);
336                        if (i >= 0) {
337                                vals[i] = val;
338                        }
339                }
340                
341                /**
342                 * Returns the slice index for this pixel slice, i.e, the
343                 * component number in the containing pixel pack.
344                 * -1 is returned if the pixel slice is not associated with
345                 * a pixel pack.
346                 * @return the slice index
347                 */
348                public int getIndex() {
349                        return idx;
350                }
351                
352                /** 
353                 * Returns a reference to the data array associated with this pixel slice.
354                 * @return the data array
355                 */
356                public float[] getArray() {
357                        return vals;
358                }
359                
360                /**
361                 * Returns the length (number of pixels) of the associated 1D pixel array.
362                 * @return the length of the image array
363                 */
364                public int getLength() {
365                        return vals.length;
366                }
367                
368                /**
369                 * Returns the width of the associated image
370                 * (see also {@link GridIndexer2D}).
371                 * @return the image width
372                 */
373                public int getWidth() {
374                        return PixelPack.this.getWidth();
375                }
376                
377                /**
378                 * Returns the height of the associated image
379                 * (see also {@link GridIndexer2D}).
380                 * @return the image height
381                 */
382                public int getHeight() {
383                        return PixelPack.this.getHeight();
384                }
385                
386                /**
387                 * Sets all pixel values to zero.
388                 */
389                public void zero() {
390                        Arrays.fill(this.vals, 0);
391                }
392                
393                /**
394                 * Copies the contents of this pixel slice to another
395                 * pixel slice.
396                 * @param other the pixel slice to modified
397                 */
398                public void copyTo(PixelSlice other) {
399                        System.arraycopy(this.vals, 0, other.vals, 0, this.vals.length);
400                }
401                
402                /**
403                 * Returns the pixel values from the 3x3 neighborhood centered at
404                 * the specified position.
405                 * The 3x3 array {@code nh[x][y]} has the coordinates
406                 * x = 0,..,2 and y = 0,..,2; 
407                 * the value at position {@code [1][1]} belongs to the 
408                 * specified position.
409                 * If a non-null array is supplied, it is filled and returned.
410                 * If null, a new array is created and returned.
411                 * 
412                 * @param uc the center x-position
413                 * @param vc the center y-position
414                 * @param nh a 3x3 array or null
415                 * @return a 3x3 array of pixel values
416                 */
417                public float[][] get3x3Neighborhood(int uc, int vc, float[][] nh) {
418                        if (nh == null) 
419                                nh = new float[3][3];
420                        for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
421                                int u = uc - 1 + i;
422                                for (int j = 0; j < 3; j++) {
423                                        int v = vc - 1 + j;
424                                        nh[i][j] = getVal(u, v);
425                                }
426                        }
427                        return nh;
428                }
429        }
430        
431        // -------------------------------------------------------------------
432        
433        /**
434         * Utility method. Copies the contents of an image processor to an existing
435         * pixel pack. They must be compatible w.r.t. size and depth.
436         * 
437         * @param ip the image processor to be copied
438         * @param pack the receiving pixel pack
439         */
440        public static void copyFromImageProcessor(ImageProcessor ip, PixelPack pack) {
441                if (ip instanceof ByteProcessor)
442                        copyFromByteProcessor((ByteProcessor)ip, pack);
443                else if (ip instanceof ShortProcessor)
444                        copyFromShortProcessor((ShortProcessor)ip, pack);
445                else if (ip instanceof FloatProcessor)
446                        copyFromFloatProcessor((FloatProcessor)ip, pack);
447                else if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor)
448                        copyFromColorProcessor((ColorProcessor)ip, pack);
449                else 
450                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("unknown processor type " + ip.getClass().getSimpleName());
451        }
452        
453        public static void copyFromByteProcessor(ByteProcessor ip, PixelPack pack) {
454                final float[][] P = pack.data;
455                byte[] pixels = (byte[]) ip.getPixels();
456                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
457                        P[0][i] = 0xff & pixels[i];
458                }
459        }
460        
461        public static void copyFromShortProcessor(ShortProcessor ip, PixelPack pack) {
462                final float[][] P = pack.data;
463                short[] pixels = (short[]) ip.getPixels();
464                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
465                        P[0][i] = 0xffff & pixels[i];
466                }
467        }
468        
469        public static void copyFromFloatProcessor(FloatProcessor ip, PixelPack pack) {
470                final float[][] P = pack.data;
471                float[] pixels = (float[]) ip.getPixels();
472                System.arraycopy(pixels, 0, P[0], 0, pixels.length);
473        }
474        
475        public static void copyFromColorProcessor(ColorProcessor ip, PixelPack pack) {
476                final float[][] P = pack.data;
477                final int[] pixels = (int[]) ip.getPixels();
478                final int[] rgb = new int[3];
479                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
480                        Rgb.intToRgb(pixels[i], rgb);
481                        P[0][i] = rgb[0];
482                        P[1][i] = rgb[1];
483                        P[2][i] = rgb[2];
484                }
485        }
486        
487        // --------------------------------------------------------------------
488        
489        /**
490         * Utility method. Copies the contents of a pixel pack to an existing
491         * image processor. They must be compatible w.r.t. size and depth.
492         * 
493         * @param pack the source pixel pack
494         * @param ip the receiving image processor
495         */
496        public void copyToImageProcessor(PixelPack pack, ImageProcessor ip) {
497                if (ip instanceof ByteProcessor)
498                        copyToByteProcessor(pack, (ByteProcessor)ip);
499                else if (ip instanceof ShortProcessor)
500                        copyToShortProcessor(pack, (ShortProcessor)ip);
501                else if (ip instanceof FloatProcessor)
502                        copyToFloatProcessor(pack, (FloatProcessor)ip);
503                else if (ip instanceof ColorProcessor)
504                        copyToColorProcessor(pack, (ColorProcessor)ip);
505                else
506                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("unknown processor type " + ip.getClass().getSimpleName());
507        }
508        
509        public static void copyToByteProcessor(PixelPack pack, ByteProcessor ip) {
510                byte[] pixels = (byte[]) ip.getPixels();
511                float[] P = pack.data[0];
512                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
513                        int val = clampByte(Math.round(P[i]));
514                        pixels[i] = (byte) val;
515                }
516        }
517        
518        public static void copyToShortProcessor(PixelPack pack, ShortProcessor ip) {
519                short[] pixels = (short[]) ip.getPixels();
520                float[] P = pack.data[0];
521                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
522                        int val = clampShort(Math.round(P[i]));
523                        pixels[i] = (short) val;
524                }
525        }
526        
527        public static void copyToFloatProcessor(PixelPack pack, FloatProcessor ip) {
528                float[] pixels = (float[]) ip.getPixels();
529                float[] P = pack.data[0];
530                System.arraycopy(P, 0, pixels, 0, P.length);
531        }
532        
533        public static void copyToColorProcessor(PixelPack pack, ColorProcessor ip) {
534                int[] pixels = (int[]) ip.getPixels();
535                float[] R = pack.data[0];
536                float[] G = pack.data[1];
537                float[] B = pack.data[2];
538                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
539                        int r = clampByte(Math.round(R[i]));
540                        int g = clampByte(Math.round(G[i]));
541                        int b = clampByte(Math.round(B[i]));
542                        pixels[i] = Rgb.rgbToInt(r, g, b);
543                }
544        }
545        
546        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
547        
548        private static int clampByte(int val) {
549                if (val < 0) return 0;
550                if (val > 255) return 255;
551                return val;
552        }
553        
554        private static int clampShort(int val) {
555                if (val < 0) return 0;
556                if (val > 65535) return 65535;
557                return val;
558        }
559
560}
